de.fhg.iml.vlog.xfvrp
Class XFVRP

java.lang.Object
  de.fhg.iml.vlog.xfvrp.XFVRP

public class XFVRP
extends java.lang.Object

XFVRP is central user interface for this suite. It combines all methods for data import, optimization execution, parameters and retrieval of solutions. The modeling of this class represents a state machine, where iteratively several methods must be called. The execution methods take all inserted data and parameters and start the optimizers.

Author:
hschneid

public XFVRP()
Method Detail

executeRoutePlanning

public void executeRoutePlanning()
Calculates the VRP with the before inserted data by addDepot(), addCustomer(), addMetric() and addVehicle() or the parameters setCapacity() and setMaxRouteDuration()

getReport

public Report getReport()
Uses the last planned solution and turns it into a report representation. All route plan informations can be akquired by this report.

Returns:
A report data structure with detailed information about the route plan or null if no solution was calculated.

setCapactiy

public void setCapactiy(float capacity)
Sets the maximal allowed capacity of a vehicle This procedure is only available for single vehicle VRPs, which means, that all already inserted vehicles will be removed and replaced by this default value.

Parameters:
capacity - Upper bound of amount, which can be transported on a route.

setMaxRouteDuration

public void setMaxRouteDuration(int maxRouteDuration)
Sets the maximal allowed route duration This procedure is only available for single vehicle VRPs, which means, that all already inserted vehicles will be removed and replaced by a default value.

Parameters:
maxRouteDuration - Upper bound of time, which can be traveled on a route.

setMaxNumberOfRoutes

public void setMaxNumberOfRoutes(int maxNumberOfRoutes)
Sets the maximal number of routes This procedure is only available for single vehicle VRPs, which means, that all already inserted vehicles will be removed and replaced by a default value.

Parameters:
maxNumberOfRoutes -

setMaxNumberOfStopsPerRoute

public void setMaxNumberOfStopsPerRoute(int maxNbrOfStops)
Sets the maximal number of stops This procedure is only available for single vehicle VRPs, which means, that all already inserted vehicles will be removed and replaced by a default value.

addCustomer

public CustomerData addCustomer()
Akquire a customer data object to insert data for a new customer. The next call of this method will finalize the before akquired customer data object.

Returns:
Customer data object

addDepot

public DepotData addDepot()
Akquire a depot data object to insert data for a new depot. The next call of this method will finalize the before akquired depot data object.

Returns:
Depot data object

addVehicle

public VehicleData addVehicle()
Akquire a vehicle data object to insert data for a new vehicle. The next call of this method will finalize the before akquired vehicle data object. The call of this method means, that default vehicle parameters are not valid any longer. In this case they have to be inserted in such a vehicle data object.

Returns:
Vehicle data object

addOptType

public void addOptType(XFVRPOptType type)
Adds a certain optimization algorithm out of the spectrum of accessible methods in the enumeration XFVRPOptType.

Parameters:
type - algorithm type. it can't be null.

setMetric

public void setMetric(Metric metric)
Sets a metric, whereby the optimization can get information about the distance or time between nodes. Metrics can relay on coordinates or on pre-calculated data.

Parameters:
metric -

Clears the state machine of all read customers

disableLifoInLoadPlanning

public void disableLifoInLoadPlanning()
Disables the lifo restriction in load planning, which means that repacking along the route could be necessary.

allowsOpenRoutesAtStart

public void allowsOpenRoutesAtStart()
By activating this flag, routes start with the first customer and ending at the depot.

allowsOpenRoutesAtEnd

public void allowsOpenRoutesAtEnd()
By activating this flag, routes end with the last customer and starting at the depot.

allowsFullOpenRoutes

public void allowsFullOpenRoutes()
By activating this flag, routes start with the first customer and ending at the depot.

setPredefinedSolutionString

public void setPredefinedSolutionString(java.lang.String predefinedSolutionString)
With this parameter a predefined solution can be inserted into the XFVRP. The solution string is strictly formated. The nodes are denotated by their name (ORT_ID). All unknown or invalid nodes are ignored by the reading routine. Double entries are resolved by ignoring later doublettes. It is not needed to assign all customer nodes. The unassign nodes are inserted in the default way by single trips. Example: { (ID1, ID2), (ID4, ID3), (ID9) } Attention: A predefined solution can be manipulated by the optimization routines. So this feature can be used in combination with NO optimization routine to validate a result or to initialize the optimization with a good starting solution.

Parameters:
predefinedSolutionString -
